III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 06/10/2025, youth and staff member were involved in a
physical altercation. Youth and staff exchanged punches.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/12/2025 along with MDHHS Specialist. Complainant did not
provide any additional information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/12/2025
along with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 denied remembering
throwing punches. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B were
horseplaying and he was intervening. Staff 1 reported multiple
youth were hitting him and Youth A told him that he was going to
beat Staff 1 up. Staff 1 reported Youth A then hit Staff 1 again so
he attempted to restrain him in a PRT hold with arms up from
behind. Staff 1 denied remembering other staff being involved in
the incident. Staff 1 reported having a “reflex” punch in return to
being hit by Youth A. Staff 1 reported a reflex punch is allowed
when being assaulted per training. Staff 1 reported Youth B was
also trying to come at him and hit him. Staff 1 reported he was hit
in the head several times by Youth A, Youth B and other youth
who he could not remember. Staff 1 denied remembering what
was being said and by whom. Staff 1 reported his back and knee
were injured and he was offered medical attention. Staff 1 denied
any youth being injured. Staff 1 denied remembering what other
staff and youth were present.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/12/25
alongside MDHHS Specialist. Youth B reported before the incident
occurred Staff 1 was attempting to get youth to settle down and
stop playing around so much. Youth B reported Staff 1 was
pushing Youth B, before Youth A hit him and he started going
back and forth with Youth A. Youth B reported Staff 1 started
2

touching Youth A so Youth A started to push back and eventually
Youth A and Staff 1 began swinging punches back and forth.
Youth B reported Staff 1 told Youth A to stop and Youth A told
Staff 1 to get out of his face. Youth B denied remembering who
else was there or if anyone was hurt.
An interview was attempted with Youth A face-to-face on
6/12/2025 however was in an escalated state and declined to
participate. Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/27/2025. Youth A reported he was playing around with Staff 1
and Staff 1 became upset by it. Youth A reported Staff 1 was
playing back with him at first but then got aggressive. Youth A
reported he and Staff 1 were horseplaying and horseplaying was
something Staff 1 would do with youth in the facility sometimes.
Youth A described the horseplaying as playing, joking, and
pushing. Youth A denied having any injuries or recalling anyone
else being injured. Youth A reported he and Staff 1 were swinging
punches back and forth and both were making contact. Youth A
reported Staff 1 made contact with his face with a punch. Youth A
did not recall Staff 1 punching anyone else. Youth A denied
awareness of how many times each one made contact with their
punches or who made contact first. Youth A reported seeing a
nurse after the incident. Youth A reported normally being cool with
Staff 1. Youth A could not recall who else was present.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on 6/27/25 along with
MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor reported responding to the
incident in the gym. Supervisor reported arriving after the incident
occurred. Supervisor reported Staff 1 reported to her the youth
were horseplaying when Youth A became serious about it and hit
Staff 1 and Staff 1 hit Youth A back. Supervisor denied recalling
what other staff and youth were present.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/27/25
alongside MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported multiple youth
including Youth A were horseplaying at which time he and Staff 1
were attempting to redirect them to stop. Staff 2 reported he, Staff
3 and Staff 1 were attempting to deescalate the situation by
getting in between youth when Youth A jumped around them and
punched Staff 1. Multiple youth were slapping and punching Staff
1 and hitting him in the head. Staff 2 denied seeing Staff 1 hit any
youth or return any punches to Youth A or any other youth. Staff 2
denied knowledge of any injuries.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/27/25
alongside MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported multiple youth were
beginning to horseplay when Staff 1 was attempting to redirect
them. Staff 3 reported the youth formed a semi-circle around him
3

while Staff 2 attempted to get in between them. Staff 3 reported
Staff 2 was attempting to push Youth A and Youth B off of him.
Staff 3 reported Youth A and Youth B were both attempting to
horseplay with Staff 1. Staff 3 reported Youth A at one point
jumped around Staff 2 to punch Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
began to swing back at Youth A. Staff 3 was not aware if anyone
was hurt.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 6/27/25
alongside MDHHS Specialist. Staff 4 reported Youth A and Youth
B were horseplaying in the gym as Staff 1 was attempting to
redirect. Staff 4 reported he approached Youth A and attempted to
talk to him to calm him down when Youth A did a “superman” jump
around Staff 4 and Staff 2 and punched Staff 1. Staff 4 reported
Youth A threw more punches at Staff 1. Staff 4 denied witnessing
Staff 1 punch back. Staff 4 was not aware if anyone was hurt.
Youth C and Youth D were each interviewed separately face-to-
face alongside MDHHS Specialist at the facility on 6/27/25. Youth
C and Youth D were identified by the facility as youth present
during the incident. Both Youth C and Youth D denied witnessing
an incident with Youth A and Staff 1 in the gymnasium.
Video Review:
• Video footage from 6/10/25 of the gymnasium was viewed.
Staff 1 is seen in the grey shirt pushing Youth B back as
Youth B attempts to engage Staff 1. At 39 seconds into the
footage Youth A is seen jumping around another youth and
swinging a closed fist at Staff 1, appearing to land his right
hand on Staff 1’s left shoulder. At 1 minute 7 seconds Staff
1 is shown engaging with Youth B as Youth B takes light
swings at Staff 1. Staff 1 is seen returning a punch with his
right arm to Youth B. Staff 3 is seen attempting to stand
between Staff 1 and Youth B. Youth B and Staff 1 move to
the wall and push one another. When Youth B backs away,
Youth A is seen hitting Staff 1 on the head. Youth A is seen
attempting to get closer to Staff 1 as Staff 2 and Staff 3
position themselves between Staff 1 and Youth A. At 1
minute, 49 seconds Youth A gets into a fighting position
with his arms up as he approaches Staff 1 to which Staff 1
lifts his arms into a similar position against the wall. Youth
A gets closer to Staff 1 appearing to say something to him
when he taps Staff 1 on his left shoulder with his right hand
and Staff 1 charges past Staff 2 and Staff 3 throwing
punches at Youth A. Youth A and Staff 1 move towards the
center of the gym throwing punches back and forth.
Documentation Review:
4

• Incident Report (IR) authored by Supervisor dated 6/10/25
states an assault between Staff 1 and Youth A occurred in
the gymnasium at approximately 5:33 PM. IR states Youth
A hit Staff 1 who threw at least one reflexive punch. IR
states CRT entered and managed the environment.
• Nursing Note regarding Youth A dated 6/10/25 states an
ice pack was administered due to discoloration to the left
side of his face and minimal swelling. A laceration to the
right side of upper lip was also noted. Per note Youth A
was asked where the injuries came from to which Youth A
would not respond.
• Human Resources File for Staff 1 includes 1 oral reprimand
for attendance. Human Resources File for Staff 1 includes
Training Hours for 2024 totaling 151 hours including Handle
With Care and 12 hours for 2025 including Verbal/Physical
Intervention.
• Email authored by Director states there is nothing in policy
and it is not trained to staff that a “reflexive” punch is
permitted.
• Physical Management Policy 10.1 states the Tension
Reduction Cycle is to be utilized to prevent escalating
tension.
Analysis A rule violation is established regarding this allegation. It is
supported via interviews and video footage Staff 1 punched Youth
A. It is further supported through video footage as Staff 1 is also
viewed charging towards Youth A to further engage in the physical
altercation.
Technical Assistance:
It is recommended the facility add specific language to their
prohibited interventions to include swinging and/or punching in
any manner including a reflexive manner is not permitted.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2025SIC0000686, CAP Approved 7/2/25
2024SIC0001796, CAP Approved 3/3/25
2025SIC0000685, CAP Pending
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
